citations.narrative:
The current program of veterinary care does not include a sampling program with a schedule approved by the attending
veterinarian for intestinal worms, coccidia, and giardia. Lack of a sampling program makes it difficult to determine the
effectiveness of the treatment plan for parasites. A sampling program for worms, coccidia, and giardia with a scheduled
approved by the attending veterinarian must be established to help maintain an effective parasite program.
This is a 1st re-license inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or within 60 days from today or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. A 2nd re-license inspection was schedule with applicant at time of this
inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The current program of veterinary care does not include a sampling program with a schedule approved by the attending 
veterinarian for intestinal worms, coccidia, and giardia. Lack of a sampling program makes it difficult to determine the 
effectiveness of the treatment plan for parasites. A sampling program for worms, coccidia, and giardia with a scheduled 
approved by the attending veterinarian must be established to help maintain an effective parasite program. 
 
This is a 1st re-license inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or within 60 days from today or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. A 2nd re-license inspection was schedule with applicant at time of this 
inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
